channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Leafs build up, 10th December
item.description:
Build up leafs had sweep them my self for last few weeks now, my brown bin is full needs emptying now because this , only been sweep once this year , in which it blocks drain if not done then floods rd

item.title: Rubbish everywhere, 10th December
item.description:
There's a massive pile of domesticamd food waste outside a property. I believe this property to be an air BnB so there's no owner around to discuss with I feel it is unfair to have to walk past this daily and have to clear the mess the foxes and rats are being through our gardens. Bin men have been leaving the bins as they are over flowing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights out in Valette House, 10th December
item.description:
The lights are out on the whole estate, they come around 16:30, then go off around 20:00. It’s been reoccurring for at least 2 weeks.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Valette Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row

item.title: Left over plastic fencing etc from pathway works, 10th December
item.description:
This fencing etc has been left on the grass verge in The Avenue, Bexley, since paving works were finished around 13 October. They have fallen into the road or onto the paving and I have had to pick them up as they represent an obstruction. They get blown over in the wind, across the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Avenue, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A shite storm of litter on the road, 10th December
item.description:
Massive amounts of litter and overflowing bins on the top end of Rushmore Road creating a health and safety hazard for all the children walking past to get their education at Millfield school

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Saratoga Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Commercial waste bins on the pavement, 10th December
item.description:
Commercial waste bins are currently permanently stored on the pavement restricting access for pedestrians wheelchair access and buggies. It’s also restricts Bike parking.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Millfields Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Rubbish from bin bags (ripped by foxes) on pavement, 10th December
item.description:
Bin bags left out at the front of the alley beside the town hall have been ripped open by foxes. Whilst the bags have been removed there is quite a lots of rubbish and mess left on the pavement area that needs cleaning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Bromley Road, Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: Potholes Harwood Avenue, 10th December
item.description:
There are several potholes which are dangerous to cyclists, both at the beginning and the end of Harwood Avenue. I hit the pothole near Nr 57 while cycling in the dark, none of the potholes are very visible esp if they are between the light from the lampposts.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harwood Avenue, Plaistow, Greater London
